p: Considering the current COVID-19 pandemic caused by the SARS-CoV-2 betacoronavirus (Ghosh et al., 2020; Lakshmi et al., 2020) we have extended our studies by docking with COVID-19 main protease (7BQY). As shown in Table 8, most of the uridine esters showed higher binding affinity with 7BQY than HCQ (–6.1 Kcal/mol). It is worth to mention that saturated fatty acyl esters with 5, 7– 8 smaller chain length exhibited better binding affinity than the higher chain length 9– 12, sulphonyl ester 6 and chlorobenzoyl esters 13– 15 ( Figure 8). The docking score of 5, 7 and 8 (–7.9 to –8.0 kcal/mol) were found to better than the previously published other compounds (Ghosh et al., 2020). Thus, uridine aliphatic esters could be better choice than HCQ in treating COVID-19 infection.
